title: Understanding Conditional Formatting
text: Conditional formatting is a feature that allows you to apply a specific format to cells that meet certain criteria. It helps to visually distinguish data based on conditions you set.

title: Identifying Incomplete Tasks
text: Highlighting incomplete tasks involves checking which tasks have a status that indicates they are not finished, such as "in progress," "to do," or another similar status.

title: Locating the 'Status' Column
text: Find the column in your spreadsheet labeled "Status." This will typically be where the completion state of a task is recorded, such as "complete," "incomplete," or "in progress."

title: Applying Conditional Formatting
text: To apply conditional formatting, you must define a rule that will look at each row's status and apply a different background color if the condition (not equal to "complete") is true.

title: Choosing the Condition
text: Consider setting a condition that checks if the status is anything other than "complete." This can be done by creating a rule such as "Status is not equal to 'complete'."

title: Formatting Options
text: You can choose a different background color to apply to these rows to make them stand out. This will serve as a visual cue for tasks that still need attention.
